casebody.data:
Baker and others against Philips. ALBANY, February, 1809. Hedges of prosecution to a declaration, are mere fern, and may be iuserted any time before judgment. THERE was a special demurrer to the declaration in this cause, for want of the pledges of prosecution. Russel, for the plaintiffs,

cited 3 Term Rep. 157. 7 Term Rep. 576.

Henry, for the defendant. Per Curiam.

The pledges of prosecution are mere matter of form, and may be entered any time before judgment. (Barnes, 163.) The plaintiffs must have judgment.

Judgment for the plaintiffs.
